title: The Greatest ES Innovation EVAR
content: The much-anticipated replaceAll method is now live! It's been long discussed, and is now available for every major browser except Internet Explorer (and why are you using IE anyway?)

title: Falsy Values in JavaScript
content:
Null, Undefined, Empty string, Zero (0, -0, BigINT0), NaN, False.
Never. Underestimate. Enemy. Zebras'. Nasty. Farts.

title: Breadth or Depth?
content: I admit, I'm a depth person myself, especially when you're starting out. Depth gives you time with your fundamentals, which gives your code a foundation. You can code successfully for a while without those fundamentals, but eventually, you're going to code yourself into a problem that doesn't make sense ... unless you understand what's going on behind the scenes.

title: In Defense of the GeoCities Aesthetic
content: It's glitzy, it's flashy, it's loud. It looks like a 4-year-old was turned loose to create a website. It's that old GeoCities aesthetic. I admit, it's nothing you want your website to look like now, but it serves its nostalgic purpose: to teach all of us to NEVER DO THAT AGAIN ... unless, of course, you ARE a 4-year-old who was turned loose to create a website.

title: Sequelize vs Tedious
content: ... well, which flavor of SQL are you using? Use the tool that goes with it.
